articles.description:
Over the weekend, Bungie disabled Destiny 2’s in-game text chat across all platforms after trolls discovered a way to use it to crash other players’ games. Now, the chat still remains off and Bungie hasn’t provided an ETA for when it will return.

With the new Grand Theft Auto Online update released last week, the game has become easier after Rockstar added more ways to make money that don’t involve ripping your hair out and putting up with annoying trolls. But a big update like this for an already massive game can be very overwhelming.

articles.description:
Diablo Immortal’s pay-to-win mechanics have been controversial since the game launched back in June. Now they’ve also apparently broken the game for at least one YouTuber who reportedly spent over $100,000 on beefing up his Barbarian character. The player’s win rate is seemingly so good the game won’t even match him…

Minecraft is a game of infinite customization, where players attempt to push boundaries on what can and cannot be done in a video game. The game has been used to recreate the entire country of Denmark, as an educational tool to introduce children to programming, and even has applications in secondary school science…

The Pokémon Company announced its next Pokémon Presents livestream will take place on August 3. The upcoming info dump on Pokémon Scarlet and Violet and other Pokémon games comes just in time as fans, desperate for new details, pour over a recent flood of alleged leaks for the earlier than expected Gen 9 entries.

Over the weekend, the Indonesian government began the task of blocking any website or service that had failed to register as part of new “internet control” laws. That ended up being a lot, including everything from Steam to the Epic Games Store to Nintendo Online to EA and Ubisoft’s platforms.

articles.description:
I had no idea there was a cover band specialising in Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater soundtracks. I’m happy enough today knowing such a thing exists, but even happier knowing that they had a show on the weekend blow up because the man himself was there and joined them on stage for a couple of tracks.

If you’ve been following along with Call Of Duty lately, you’re no stranger to seeing skins that remind of something you’ve seen before, be it John McClain from Die Hard or Ghostface from Scream. articles.description:
Are you feeling sleepy?
Earlier this week, The Pokémon Company confirmed that it will be broadcasting a new 'Pokémon Presents' show, featuring "updates on Pokémon apps and video games, including Pokémon Scarlet and Violet".
Scarlet and Violet are, of course, heading to the Nintendo Switch on November 18th, 2022, and while we already know quite a hefty amount about the new mainline games, The Pokémon Company clearly has a few surprises up its sleeve for its latest broadcast.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Poll: What Are You Hoping To See From This Week's 'Pokémon Presents'?

articles.description:
"Hear that, Noah?".
If you're a long-standing Xenoblade series fan, then you're probably used to hearing the same lines of dialogue over and over again, whether it's post-battle, or when opening a chest or gathering items.
Xenoblade Chronicles has a few of these — who can forget "I'm really feeling it?" from Shulk, something we abuse constantly here at Nintendo Life when we're covering Xenoblade news. And "Now it's Reyn time" has also entered the pantheon of video game memes. Xenoblade Chronicles 2 had even more, including a couple of lines — "Think you can take me?" and "Don't forget me" — that were edited in a patch.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Random: Xenoblade Chronicles 3 Has Plenty Of Very Memeable Dialogue

Starts 4th August.
Nintendo of Europe has announced a brand new sale that will be kicking off on 4th August.
Similar to the North American sale — which kicked off last week — the Showdown Sale promises up to 80% off of Switch multiplayer games. While Nintendo hasn't revealed what it'll be discounting, we're already saving our pennies up.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Nintendo's 'Multiplayer Showdown Sale' Promises Big Savings Later This Week (Europe)

articles.description:
The future of gaming?
Logitech G, the gaming branch of the Swiss peripheral giant Logitech, has announced that it has partnered with Tencent Games to work on a dedicated cloud-based handheld device.
As reported by The Verge, the system is currently very much in active developement, and nothing has been announced at this time regarding release date, pricing, or what the system will actually look like. What we do know, however, is it will be a handheld alternative to smart phone peripherals and will support services such as Xbox Cloud Gaming and Nvidia’s GeForce Now, with Logitech and Tencent working with both Microsoft and Nvidia on the hardware.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Logitech And Tencent Games Are Working On A Cloud-Based Handheld Console

articles.description:
Nintendo's console was conspiciously absent from the reveal.
When the upcoming wrestling game AEW: Fight Forever was announced by publisher THQ Nordic, the Switch was noticably absent from the line-up of target hardware. However, a fresh listing on Amazon UK suggests that the title may be heading to Nintendo's system after all.
Noticed and posted by Gematsu on Twitter, the listing states a placeholder date of December 31st, 2022 at a standard price of £49.99.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Amazon Listing Suggests 'AEW: Fight Forever' Is Heading To Switch After All

articles.description:
And it looks amazing!
The Super Mario Land series for the original Game Boy might not necessarily be quite as well known as the major entries on consoles, but it was also an introduction to the world of Mario for many Nintendo fans at the time.
Unfortunately, we only got three entries in this series, and from the third game onwards, Wario sort of hijacked the entire series. If you've ever wondered though what the Super Mario Land series might have looked like if it did make it to the GBA generation - with Mario and Luigi at the helm, here you go.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Random: Pixel Artist Reimagines Super Mario Land Series For Game Boy Advance

"It's time for Street Fighter & other great fighting games".
EVO 2022 kicks off later this week and as part of this Sony has announced a new live show featuring "exciting content and reveals".
According to IGN, publishers and developers like Capcom, Warner Bros., Bandai Namco, Arc System Works, and SNK will all be participating in the show. While some fans appear to have been expecting a possible announcement about the next Mortal Kombat game, it seems this won't be happening.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Ed Boon Shuts Down Mortal Kombat 12 'EVO 2022' Announcement Speculation

Brace Yourself Games - best known on the Nintendo Switch for its amazing work on Cadence of Hyrule: Crypt of the NecroDancer - has taken to social media to tease an upcoming announcement.

Unlock themes you missed out on in the 30th event.
Nintendo has just announced the Switch Online game Tetris 99 will be hosting its 30th Maximus Cup. It kicks off this Friday on 5th August and will give players a "second chance" at unlocking themes they may have missed out on before.
Instead of having to earn 100 event points for each theme, this time around you'll only have to earn 10 event points per round - meaning you can quickly snap up multiple themes one after the other. Here's a bit of PR about it:

Pac-Man, Shin-chan and much more.
August isn't quite as happening as last month, but there's still plenty on the Switch front to anticipate. This month players can expect games like Pac-Man, Two Point Campus, Shin-Chan, and a sprinkle of indie-style games. So here's the round-up:

articles.title: Video: 10 Exciting New Games Coming To Nintendo Switch In August 2022

articles.description:
We're going on a summer vacation.
One of the games we're most excited for this month is Shin-Chan: Me And The Professor On Summer Vacation – The Endless Seven-Day Journey — yes, the title really is that long. The game is inspired by the My Summer Vacation series and has been developed by the same team, Millennium Kitchen.
Originally released in Japan last year, we didn't expect we'd ever see it in the West. But we were pleasantly surprised a few months ago when publisher Neos Corporation revealed the game would be coming out in English this summer! One of the biggest reasons we were surprised is that none of the My Summer Vacation games made their way over to the West, but we still wanted to celebrate the upcoming Shin-Chan game's release by playing one of Millennium Kitchen's games. And, so, we did.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Video: Don't Forget About Attack of the Friday Monsters!

articles.description:
As smooth as a turtle's shell.
Konami has delivered more good news for Turtles fans today. At the end of the month, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection will be launching on Switch. And the compilation's publisher has revealed that one game is getting some modern-day enhancements to help with online play.
Of the 13 games included in the Cowabunga Collection, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tournament Fighters for SNES will be getting rollback netcode! This fighting game got three different versions back in the day — one on NES, SNES, and Mega Drive Genesis, and all three are on the collection — but so far the company has only revealed that the SNES game is getting the modern-day fighting game essential.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: TMNT: The Cowabunga Collection Features Rollback Netcode For SNES 'Tournament Fighters'

articles.description:
Is "more of the same" going to be enough?
Splatoon 3 is just a handful of weeks away from launch, with the sequel heading to the Switch on September 9th. Despite the fact that Nintendo has been drip-feeding bits of news here and there on Twitter, including new songs, gear reveals, and new multiplayer maps, there's a distinct feeling amongst the community that the marketing around the game has been a bit lacklustre.
It's no surprise, either. The launch of Xenoblade Chronicles 3 has understandably taken up a lot of Nintendo's time over the past few weeks, with the company bombarding fans with new trailers, gameplay footage, interviews, and more. Now that the game is out, though, can we expect Nintendo to shift its focus over to Splatoon 3? Well, yes, theoretically. That hasn't stopped some fans from getting quite worried, though, particularly in the wake of a new Pokémon Presents being announced for later this week (though we fully acknowledge that this is more of a Pokémon Company event rather than a Nintendo one):
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Random: People Are Getting Pretty Worried About Splatoon 3

articles.description:
Feeling hot?
Rawlab Games, in collaboration with Japanese company Tatsujin, has announced that the erotic '90s arcade game Pipi & Bibi’s is currently in development for the Nintendo Switch. Originally released in 1991, the game was developed by Toaplan, but after the company's bankruptcy in 1994, most of its IP rights went over to Tatsujin.
As reported by Go Nintendo, the remaster will launch under the title Spy Bros. (Pipi & Bibi’s DX) and is currently targeted for Q4 2022. The publisher has announced that little is being done to alter the game's visuals and mechanics, with the developer opting to stay true to the original's aethetics, however design improvements and bonus content will be included in the new release (so it's probably more of a modern port than a remaster).
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Erotic Arcade Game From The '90s Is About To Raise Pulses On Switch

articles.description:
Save on Switch Online subs, too!
It's summer, the sun's out, and we're feeling generous, so what better way to kick off August than with a huge sale across lots of different Switch goodies at the Nintendo Life store?
That's right, we're slashing the price of everything on our store by 10% – that's including games, DLC, Switch Online subs, and our super-popular discounted eShop credit vouchers – for the duration of August. So from now until the 31st, pop anything in your basket and use code NLIFE10 to save some pennies on your next eShop purchase.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Deals: Get 10% Off Switch eShop Credit And Top Games In The Nintendo Life Store Sale

articles.description:
But fans are answering back.
Bandai Namco's Digimon Survive launched last Friday, and many Digimon fans have rushed out to grab a copy of the game. Out on Xbox One, PS4, Switch, and PC, the game combines visual novel elements with some strategy RPG gameplay, and is a very different Digimon game altogether.
However, despite some fans' excitement at getting this much-delayed Digimon game, Digimon Survive is currently being review bombed over on Metacritic. TheGamer reports that users are flocking to the aggregate website to share their opinions and score the game down. Over the weekend, the User Score for the Switch version was right down to 1.6, and by the time TheGamer spotted it, it had jumped up a little to 4.3.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Digimon Survive Is Getting Review Bombed On Metacritic

articles.description:
Graphics, UI, and more given some TLC.
Dead Cells, the game that seemingly just keeps on giving, has been updated by developer Motion Twin to version 1.19.1, introducing a number of quality-of-life improvements that should make for a better experience for everyone.
While not as substantial as previous updates, there have been a number of improvements to the graphics and UI, along with some general bug fixes. Here are the full patch notes from Motion Twin:

articles.title: Dead Cells Receives New Update, Here Are The Full Patch Notes

articles.description:
The concert is tonight.
The BBC Proms is probably one of the most well-known classical music concerts in the world. This eight-week extravaganza holds daily concerts for various classical music composers and film scores. But in 2022, the Proms is making history by holding its first-ever video game concert.
Conducted by Robert Ames, the show starts tonight at 7:30pm in the Royal Albert Hall. Some of gaming's most well-known tunes will debut at this annual event and hopefully kick off a new trend of featuring the medium every year. The prominence of video game music has grown hugely over the past few years, with franchises like Kirby winning Grammy Awards.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Zelda, Pokémon, And Final Fantasy Music Will Feature At The First-Ever Video Game Proms

articles.description:
Updates on apps and video games to come.
The official Pokémon Twitter account has announced a brand new Pokémon Presents for later this week.
On Wednesday 3rd August at 6am PDT / 9am EDT / 2pm BST / 3pm CET, we'll be getting some new information on the next mainline games, Pokémon Scarlet & Violet, alongside details and updates for apps, so likely Pokémon Unite and Pokémon GO! But maybe there will be some surprises.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Pokémon Presents Will Feature New Scarlet & Violet Info Later This Week

articles.description:
One small change saved the day.
Xenoblade Chronicles' protagonist Shulk is pretty well known in the Nintendo community as the picture of innocence; a truly noble hero who always puts his friends and allies first. Apparently, however, according to a recent video from Did You Know Gaming, Shulk's actions during one of the game's cutscenes alarmed scenario writer Yurie Hattori, who was brought in during the game's development.
As pointed out by series' Executive Director Tetsuya Takahashi, Hattori-san was worried that Shulk's decision to touch the cheek of an unconscious Fiora to express his feelings for her might be construed as creepy. As such, the action was changed for the final game, with Shulk instead touching Fiora's hand.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Random: Xenoblade Chronicles' Shulk Cutscene Was Originally 'A Little Creepy'

articles.description:
How deep does the cave go?
Next month, the first video game adaptation of the hit anime series Made in Abyss will be hitting the Switch. And thanks to the eShop and Nintendo Everything, we might have a good idea how big a hole you'll need to dig to make room for the game.
The upcoming RPG from Spike Chunsoft, Made in Abyss: Binary Star Falling into Darkness, will have both a retelling of the anime (with production supervised by the creator Akihito Tsukushi) plus an original story set after main characters Riko and Reg leave for the Abyss.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Made In Abyss: Binary Star Falling Into Darkness File Size Seemingly Revealed

articles.description:
What a superman!
For Tony Hawk's Pro Skater tribute act 'The 900', it was likely going to be "just another gig". Described as "The UK's first and only Tony Hawk's Pro Skater cover band", the act plays a variety of cover songs from THPS1 all the way to American Wasteland and was due to perform at Signature Brew in East London on July 30th.
To the surprise of everyone - including the band - Tony Hawk himself showed up, joining The 900 on stage to perform two of the most popular songs from the Pro Skater series - Goldfinger's 'Superman', and Agent Orange's 'Bloodstains'. It turned what was likely going to be a pretty standard evening for the band into an unforgettable experience for everyone involved.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Random: Tony Hawk Gatecrashed A Pro Skater Tribute Act, Shocking Everyone

articles.description:
"...it's looking like I'll run out sometime in August".
Even though Super Smash Bros. Ultimate "ended" with the release of the last Fighters Pass character — Kingdom Hearts' Sora — it still hasn't felt "over" for us. That's because Masahiro Sakurai, Mr. Smash Bros. himself, has continued a long-standing tradition of posting a new screenshot from the game every single day.
We're envious of pretty much all of them, as Sakurai managed to capture characters, locations, and moments in such a perfect way that really understands the characters. In fact, seeing these screenshots every day has brought us a little bit of happiness — and envy. But it looks like this tradition might soon be over, as Sakurai has admitted on Twitter that he's almost run out of screens!
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Masahiro Sakurai Is Almost Out Of Smash Ultimate Screenshots

articles.description:
Plus classes and more.
Gameloft's free-to-play racing game Disney Speedstorm has already been compared to Mario Kart 8 Deluxe numerous times. With its character-focused racing and themed tracks, it was inevitable — especially on the Switch! But, in an interview with Nintendo Everything, the developer is keen to set out what makes this title stand out from Nintendo's juggernaut kart racer.
While Mario Kart 8 has different types of karts, stats, and even racer weights, Disney Speedstorm will have four different classes. When asked about what makes this game "stand out", Gameloft Barcelona's game manager — Aska Suzuki — put forward this unique element first:
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Disney's New Free-To-Play Racer Wants To Be Distinct From Mario Kart With "Combat Racing"

With cancelled pre-order comes small discount. Isn’t that the motto of Spider-Man? Well, it’s close enough under the circumstances. The price drop only applies in a few regions, but means that anyone who pre-ordered the game there might want to cancel theirs and buy it again. Or, you know, just wait until the game’s out.

Not so much now though, as the game’s senior director Tom Cannon has revealed that Project L will be free-to-play. You can also catch a glimpse of the newly announced hero Illaoi in the video below.
